body_html:
There are a number of files generated using protobuf (from .proto files),
but I'm pretty sure that's supported out of the box by cmake. There are
also build rules for Cuda files (using nvcc), which may be a fairly rare
use case, but also shouldn't be a huge problem. Finally, we are using swig
to wrap C++ code in python. The rest is just building c++ and copying
things to the right places.

In all, it's not a simple project to convert, but all that's necessary is
contained in the BUILD files (and the bazel docs).

Since cmake would help with a lot of platform issues (Windows support,
embedded support, etc.), we are more than happy to help, and we'd be very
excited about contributions in this area.
